data:
1
00:00:16,083 --> 00:00:18,291
First, there was darkness.

2
00:00:19,763 --> 00:00:22,548
Then came the Strangers.

3
00:00:22,580 --> 00:00:25,204
They were a race
as old as time itself.

4
00:00:26,260 --> 00:00:28,851
They had mastered
the ultimate technology--

5
00:00:28,852 --> 00:00:33,939
the ability to alter
physical reality by will alone.

6
00:00:33,940 --> 00:00:36,436
They called this ability
''Tuning.''

7
00:00:37,588 --> 00:00:39,381
But they were dying.

8
00:00:39,411 --> 00:00:42,292
Their civilization was
in decline,

9
00:00:42,356 --> 00:00:44,949
and so they abandoned
their world,

10
00:00:45,013 --> 00:00:47,541
seeking a cure
for their own mortality.

11
00:00:48,885 --> 00:00:52,276
Their endless journey brought
them to a small, blue world...

12
00:00:52,277 --> 00:00:54,294
in the farthest corner
of the galaxy.

13
00:00:55,286 --> 00:00:56,694
Our world.

14
00:00:57,685 --> 00:00:59,668
Here, they thought
they had finally found...

15
00:00:59,669 --> 00:01:01,526
what they had been
searching for.

16
00:01:11,893 --> 00:01:14,677
My name is
Dr. Daniel Poe Schreber.

17
00:01:15,607 --> 00:01:17,174
l am just a man.

18
00:01:17,240 --> 00:01:20,358
l help the Strangers
conduct their experiments.

19
00:01:21,431 --> 00:01:23,382
l have betrayed my own kind.

20
00:04:42,369 --> 00:04:44,098
You are confused, aren't you?

21
00:04:44,130 --> 00:04:46,850
Frightened. That's all right.
l can help you.

22
00:04:46,851 --> 00:04:48,355
-Who is this?
-l'm a doctor.

23
00:04:48,417 --> 00:04:51,073
You must listen to me.
You have lost your memory.

24
00:04:51,074 --> 00:04:53,154
There was an experiment.
Something went wrong.

25
00:04:53,155 --> 00:04:55,265
Your memory was erased.
Do you understand me?

26
00:04:55,266 --> 00:04:57,281
No, l don't understand.
What's going on here?

27
00:04:57,282 --> 00:05:00,001
There are people coming for you
as we speak.

28
00:05:00,002 --> 00:05:02,210
Don't let them find you.
Leave now.

29
00:05:03,330 --> 00:05:05,411
Hello? Are you there?

30
00:05:45,862 --> 00:05:48,230
Hey, Mr. Murdoch,
the Automat called.

31
00:05:48,262 --> 00:05:49,702
Said you left your wallet there.

32
00:05:50,726 --> 00:05:54,245
l suggest you retrieve it, since
you only paid for three weeks,

33
00:05:54,246 --> 00:05:55,942
and they was up 10 minutes ago.

34
00:05:57,926 --> 00:05:59,334
l've been here three weeks?

35
00:05:59,366 --> 00:06:02,438
lt's right there
in black and white, Mr. Murdoch.

36
00:06:02,439 --> 00:06:04,743
Day and date.

37
00:06:04,775 --> 00:06:08,005
We make our books like we make
our beds, all neat and tidy.

38
00:06:08,006 --> 00:06:10,918
-l'll take care of it later.
-See that you do.

39
00:06:10,919 --> 00:06:12,997
Only thing makes you a guest
in this joint...

40
00:06:12,998 --> 00:06:14,311
is cash on the barrelhead!

41
00:06:31,463 --> 00:06:34,120
House rules.
Three weeks is three weeks.

42
00:06:34,121 --> 00:06:36,519
No days off for good behavior.

43
00:06:47,016 --> 00:06:50,504
Mr. Murdoch, yes?
Where is he?

44
00:06:50,568 --> 00:06:53,866
He just left
not five minutes ago.

45
00:06:55,210 --> 00:06:56,841
Sleep now.

46
00:06:59,369 --> 00:07:03,209
When the rumba rhythm
start to play

47
00:07:03,273 --> 00:07:05,322
Dance with me

48
00:07:05,387 --> 00:07:08,297
Make me sway

49
00:07:08,361 --> 00:07:12,138
Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore

50
00:07:12,202 --> 00:07:14,347
Hold me close

51
00:07:14,379 --> 00:07:17,098
Sway me more

52
00:07:17,130 --> 00:07:21,227
Like a flower bending
in the breeze

53
00:07:21,259 --> 00:07:23,595
Bend with me

54
00:07:23,627 --> 00:07:26,347
Sway with ease

55
00:07:26,379 --> 00:07:30,155
When we dance,
you have a way with me

56
00:07:30,219 --> 00:07:32,587
Stay with me

57
00:07:32,619 --> 00:07:35,051
Sway with me

58
00:07:35,821 --> 00:07:39,754
Hey, sweetie, he said he was
your husband's doctor.

59
00:07:39,755 --> 00:07:41,228
He wanted to speak with you.

60
00:08:00,621 --> 00:08:01,805
Excuse me.

61
00:08:03,725 --> 00:08:05,197
-Doctor...
-Schreber.

62
00:08:05,261 --> 00:08:09,501
Please, won't you come in?
You must be Emma Murdoch.

63
00:08:10,414 --> 00:08:13,708
Thank you for coming to see me
on such short notice.

64
00:08:13,709 --> 00:08:15,117
What is this?

65
00:08:15,149 --> 00:08:18,636
A rather crude experiment
designed to further my studies.

66
00:08:18,637 --> 00:08:22,190
l don't understand. You say
you're my husband's doctor,

67
00:08:22,191 --> 00:08:24,623
but he never
mentioned you to me.

68
00:08:24,687 --> 00:08:27,407
The truth is, John has been
coming to see me...

69
00:08:27,408 --> 00:08:28,782
for quite some time.

70
00:08:28,814 --> 00:08:32,078
He had been grappling
with feelings of betrayal...

71
00:08:32,079 --> 00:08:35,053
stemming from
your marital difficulties.

72
00:08:35,054 --> 00:08:36,879
-John told you what happened.
-Yes.

73
00:08:38,223 --> 00:08:40,430
When was the last time
that you saw him?

74
00:08:40,431 --> 00:08:43,216
Three weeks ago.
He packed a suitcase.

75
00:08:43,248 --> 00:08:45,616
He was very angry at me.

76
00:08:45,680 --> 00:08:48,431
l understand how difficult
this must be for you,

77
00:08:48,432 --> 00:08:49,744
but for John's sake,

78
00:08:49,776 --> 00:08:52,624
l would like you to think of me
as your friend, Emma.

79
00:08:52,625 --> 00:08:56,174
lt appears that John
has suffered a psychotic break.

80
00:08:56,175 --> 00:08:59,215
-Complete memory loss.
-You can't be serious.

81
00:08:59,216 --> 00:09:02,065
Oh, but l am.
He may be delusional.

82
00:09:02,097 --> 00:09:03,281
Even violent.

83
00:09:04,625 --> 00:09:08,432
lf he were to contact you,
you must call me immediately.

84
00:09:08,433 --> 00:09:11,201
Wherever your husband is,
he is searching...

85
00:09:12,496 --> 00:09:13,618
For himself.

86
00:09:23,410 --> 00:09:27,522
Good evening, Mr. Murdoch.
lt is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it?

87
00:09:28,049 --> 00:09:31,345
Mr. ''J'' something Murdoch?

88
00:09:34,578 --> 00:09:38,979
J. Murdoch. What's your name?
Justin? Jerry?

89
00:09:42,707 --> 00:09:44,691
My name's Jason Murdoch.
John Murdoch.

90
00:09:44,755 --> 00:09:47,619
Jake Murdoch. How's it going?
Hi. Jack Murdoch.

91
00:09:53,331 --> 00:09:54,996
Got to get a grip on myself.

92
00:10:18,132 --> 00:10:21,365
l told the guy,
cash on the barrelhead.

93
00:10:21,397 --> 00:10:24,595
l said, ''Listen,
three weeks is three weeks.''

94
00:10:24,596 --> 00:10:28,422
-Where's our lucky winner?
-Upstairs, sir. Room 614.

95
00:10:29,238 --> 00:10:30,516
The call girl.

96
00:10:34,965 --> 00:10:37,781
-Evening, Husselbeck.
-lnspector Bumstead.

97
00:10:37,782 --> 00:10:39,413
Your lace is untied.

98
00:10:40,663 --> 00:10:41,815
Sorry.

99
00:10:49,942 --> 00:10:51,415
Am l glad you're here, sir.

100
00:10:51,479 --> 00:10:54,038
They say Detective Walenski's
got the heebie-jeebies.

101
00:10:54,039 --> 00:10:56,518
Just take what they give me,
Husselbeck.

102
00:11:25,785 --> 00:11:28,185
-Thanks a lot.
-Excuse me.

103
00:11:30,553 --> 00:11:32,216
-Hello?
-Oh, it's you.

104
00:11:32,953 --> 00:11:35,576
-You left your wallet here.
-When did l do that?

105
00:11:35,577 --> 00:11:37,720
-When you was last here.
-When was that?

106
00:11:37,721 --> 00:11:41,386
When you left your wallet.
Expect me to remember?

107
00:11:46,553 --> 00:11:49,210
-Excuse me!
-No, no, seriously.

108
00:12:05,883 --> 00:12:07,642
-Where you headed, chief?
-Home.

109
00:12:07,676 --> 00:12:08,954
And where's home?

110
00:12:08,986 --> 00:12:11,674
Haven't you mugs got
anything better to do?

111
00:12:11,675 --> 00:12:13,850
l'm just doing my job, May.

112
00:12:13,882 --> 00:12:15,835
There's a killer out there.

113
00:12:15,900 --> 00:12:18,828
Look for him
instead of cooling your heels.

114
00:12:21,627 --> 00:12:23,260
Go on. Get out of here.

115
00:12:31,868 --> 00:12:32,860
Come on.

116
00:12:35,997 --> 00:12:38,714
What's that make so far?
Six hookers in all?

117
00:12:38,715 --> 00:12:41,900
-l believe so, sir.
-Give the man an ''A'' for effort.

118
00:12:46,684 --> 00:12:48,894
So, Husselbeck,

119
00:12:48,924 --> 00:12:55,165
what kind of killer do you think
stops to save a dying fish?

120
00:12:55,166 --> 00:12:56,989
-Got me, sir.
-Bumstead.

121
00:12:57,021 --> 00:13:00,187
What took you? This killer's
been running circles around us,

122
00:13:00,188 --> 00:13:01,246
thanks to Walenski.

123
00:13:01,310 --> 00:13:03,037
With all due respect,
Chief lnspector,

124
00:13:03,069 --> 00:13:06,045
l've known Eddie a long time,
and he's a good cop.

125
00:13:06,046 --> 00:13:08,221
Whatever kind of cop
Walenski once was...

126
00:13:08,222 --> 00:13:10,079
he let drift a long time ago.

127
00:13:10,111 --> 00:13:11,808
Let me talk to Bumstead!

128
00:13:11,838 --> 00:13:13,791
Come on! Hold on!

129
00:13:14,462 --> 00:13:15,550
Frank!

130
00:13:18,527 --> 00:13:20,480
-Get his arm !
-They're watching us!

131
00:13:20,544 --> 00:13:22,720
-On your feet!
-There's no way out!

132
00:13:24,064 --> 00:13:25,662
God, can't you see?

133
00:13:28,960 --> 00:13:31,232
Let me go!
l'm not going to hurt you.

134
00:13:32,704 --> 00:13:34,783
-What was that?
-Walenski.

135
00:13:42,881 --> 00:13:45,856
l'm being punished
for my sins, right?

136
00:13:45,920 --> 00:13:50,080
What did l ever do to inherit
this? Where do you begin?

137
00:13:50,081 --> 00:13:52,928
Well, everything Detective
Walenski committed to paper...

138
00:13:52,929 --> 00:13:54,306
should be here, so--

139
00:13:54,338 --> 00:13:57,234
The only thing that should be
committed is Walenski.

140
00:13:59,073 --> 00:14:00,866
Nothing like
a little healthy paranoia.

141
00:14:07,139 --> 00:14:10,369
l came here to file a missing
persons report for my husband.

142
00:14:10,370 --> 00:14:14,065
-Take it to the front desk.
-They told me to come see you.

143
00:14:15,841 --> 00:14:17,410
His name's John Murdoch.

144
00:14:20,386 --> 00:14:23,586
Do these names mean
anything to you?

145
00:14:24,387 --> 00:14:26,274
Who are these women?

146
00:14:26,306 --> 00:14:28,099
Why are you looking
for my husband?

147
00:14:28,131 --> 00:14:30,338
Are you going to accuse him
of something?

148
00:14:30,339 --> 00:14:33,730
-Maybe. Maybe murder.
-Whose murder?

149
00:14:35,107 --> 00:14:38,212
-Which one?
-All of them.

150
00:14:39,586 --> 00:14:42,786
Mrs. Murdoch, l am sorry.
l didn't mean to alarm you.

151
00:14:42,787 --> 00:14:45,443
l'm sorry that l came.
l just made a mistake.

152
00:14:45,444 --> 00:14:49,460
lf you'd please just give me
half a second to explain.

153
00:14:58,052 --> 00:14:59,236
We met before?

154
00:15:00,869 --> 00:15:03,811
lf we did,
l hope you're still breathing.

155
00:15:03,812 --> 00:15:05,316
What's your name, honey?

156
00:15:08,964 --> 00:15:10,661
Well, that's
an appropriate name.

157
00:15:18,278 --> 00:15:19,526
l was just thinking.

158
00:15:23,558 --> 00:15:25,029
What you do...

159
00:15:26,215 --> 00:15:31,110
lt seems kind of dangerous...
right now.

160
00:15:31,111 --> 00:15:32,966
How do you know
l'm not the killer?

161
00:15:32,998 --> 00:15:36,535
You don't seem like
the killer type. Why?

162
00:15:37,031 --> 00:15:39,512
You feeling any urges
l should know about?

163
00:15:50,759 --> 00:15:51,847
Shoot.

164
00:16:37,578 --> 00:16:41,321
So it seems you've discovered
your unpleasant nature.

165
00:16:41,322 --> 00:16:45,370
-Who are you?
-We might ask the same question.

166
00:16:45,930 --> 00:16:48,041
Sleep...now.

167
00:17:12,556 --> 00:17:13,676
He can Tune!

168
00:18:04,720 --> 00:18:07,790
What is to be done?
This man is dangerous.

169
00:18:07,791 --> 00:18:10,831
-lt is said he is able to Tune.
-lmpossible!

170
00:18:10,832 --> 00:18:13,742
We have seen it
with our own eyes.

171
00:18:13,807 --> 00:18:16,558
On occasion, the imprinting
does not take.

172
00:18:16,559 --> 00:18:19,022
They behave erratically
when they awaken.

173
00:18:19,023 --> 00:18:22,576
We find them wandering
like lost children.

174
00:18:22,577 --> 00:18:24,624
But this one was different, yes?

175
00:18:24,689 --> 00:18:28,303
-What has the doctor to say?
-He has failed to report in.

176
00:18:28,304 --> 00:18:31,279
-And Mr. Quick?
-No more Mr. Quick.

177
00:18:31,343 --> 00:18:33,842
Mr. Quick...dead, yes.

178
00:18:37,105 --> 00:18:39,601
Poor, poor Mr. Quick.

179
00:18:39,665 --> 00:18:42,482
Mr. Book...does he know?

180
00:18:43,441 --> 00:18:45,393
Should we not know, Mr. Hand?

181
00:18:46,384 --> 00:18:49,200
We had hoped to learn more
before sharing with you.

182
00:18:49,201 --> 00:18:52,049
We can know nothing
until we possess him.

183
00:18:52,050 --> 00:18:54,225
We must have this man.

184
00:18:59,922 --> 00:19:01,010
My brand, l hope.

185
00:19:12,852 --> 00:19:14,354
l've been worried about you.

186
00:19:18,227 --> 00:19:19,507
Are you punishing me?

187
00:19:20,242 --> 00:19:22,803
lf disappearing is
your way of punishing me,

188
00:19:22,804 --> 00:19:23,924
l don't appreciate it.

189
00:19:23,986 --> 00:19:25,076
What are you talking about?

190
00:19:28,467 --> 00:19:32,515
l found these keys in my pocket,
so l assume l live here.

191
00:19:34,195 --> 00:19:36,837
-You supposed to be my wife?
-''Supposed to be''?

192
00:19:39,828 --> 00:19:44,068
You really...don't know
who l am, do you.

193
00:19:44,500 --> 00:19:47,219
Your doctor called me. He was
worried that this might happen.

194
00:19:47,220 --> 00:19:48,468
My doctor?

195
00:19:51,285 --> 00:19:55,205
He gave me his card.
He's desperate to find you.

196
00:20:02,261 --> 00:20:04,245
Feel like l'm living out
someone else's nightmare.

197
00:20:04,246 --> 00:20:07,333
What happened to me?
Why was l seeing a doctor?

198
00:20:07,478 --> 00:20:08,918
l had an affair.

199
00:20:10,741 --> 00:20:12,053
You were angry at me.

200
00:20:15,094 --> 00:20:18,582
Closing time.
The pool is now closed.

201
00:20:27,927 --> 00:20:30,167
Most unfortunate it is...

202
00:20:30,199 --> 00:20:32,807
that we were forced
to seek you out here.

203
00:20:33,336 --> 00:20:37,703
You know how uncomfortable
we find all this moisture.

204
00:20:38,168 --> 00:20:41,366
-l'm sorry. l--
-Failed to report in, yes?

205
00:20:41,367 --> 00:20:44,215
l was frightened.
l have a weak heart, you know.

206
00:20:44,216 --> 00:20:47,639
Your weakness is not, we think,
an affair of the heart.

207
00:20:47,640 --> 00:20:50,168
We found this in his hotel room.

208
00:20:50,232 --> 00:20:53,655
Must we reproduce
Mr. Murdoch's memories again?

209
00:20:53,656 --> 00:20:55,673
l tried to reprint him,
but he woke up.

210
00:20:55,737 --> 00:20:57,880
He knocked the syringe
right out of my hand.

211
00:20:57,881 --> 00:21:00,985
-He has no memories, then?
-Only fragments.

212
00:21:00,986 --> 00:21:02,424
The procedure,
it was interrupted.

213
00:21:02,488 --> 00:21:05,448
l guess it's only a matter
of rounding him up.

214
00:21:05,786 --> 00:21:07,416
You have had strays
before, right?

215
00:21:07,480 --> 00:21:11,224
This is no stray, Doctor.
This one can Tune.

216
00:21:11,225 --> 00:21:14,200
But that's impossible.
Only you have that ability.

217
00:21:14,201 --> 00:21:16,409
You will process
another template...

218
00:21:16,441 --> 00:21:18,394
of the subject's memories, yes?

219
00:21:18,458 --> 00:21:19,931
Of course.
l'll imprint him again.

220
00:21:21,497 --> 00:21:24,634
We require them
for a quite different purpose.

221
00:21:24,635 --> 00:21:27,323
lt's almost midnight,
Dr. Schreber.

222
00:21:27,355 --> 00:21:29,145
We'll talk again
after tonight's Tuning,

223
00:21:29,146 --> 00:21:31,963
but no more delays, yes?

224
00:21:31,995 --> 00:21:37,002
No more inconsistencies
in your behavior.

225
00:21:38,395 --> 00:21:39,962
The police were looking for you.

226
00:21:40,026 --> 00:21:42,075
l know. l saw the papers.

227
00:21:42,139 --> 00:21:44,507
''Killer stalks
city street-walkers.''

228
00:21:47,995 --> 00:21:50,205
l was with one of those women.

229
00:21:51,675 --> 00:21:55,004
-Before l came here tonight.
-l don't understand.

230
00:21:55,005 --> 00:22:00,140
l met her outside an Automat.
l guess l wanted to test myself.

231
00:22:01,373 --> 00:22:04,668
l wanted to know if l had it
in me to do those things.

232
00:22:04,669 --> 00:22:06,077
Maybe l have lost my mind,

233
00:22:06,141 --> 00:22:09,388
but whoever l am, l'm still me,
and l'm not a killer.

234
00:22:14,781 --> 00:22:16,029
l believe you.

235
00:22:17,854 --> 00:22:18,972
You do?

236
00:22:23,389 --> 00:22:25,278
-What?
-The car outside.

237
00:22:25,341 --> 00:22:26,717
The one you arrived in.

238
00:22:26,751 --> 00:22:28,959
lt's a cop.
He dropped me off here.

239
00:22:31,038 --> 00:22:32,703
l didn't know he was still here.

240
00:22:36,158 --> 00:22:37,567
Hold it right there, mister!

241
00:22:39,870 --> 00:22:42,814
-Wait. You have the wrong man.
-Stand aside, will you, please?

242
00:22:42,815 --> 00:22:44,224
l didn't kill anyone.

243
00:22:44,254 --> 00:22:46,461
Right now,
all you are is a suspect.

244
00:22:46,495 --> 00:22:49,597
Turn yourself in. l'll listen
to whatever you have to say.

245
00:22:49,598 --> 00:22:51,584
You won't believe
what l have to say.

246
00:22:52,704 --> 00:22:55,807
-Try me.
-There's someone after me.

247
00:22:55,871 --> 00:22:59,392
lt's this group of men.
They want me dead.

248
00:22:59,393 --> 00:23:02,174
And l don't even know if...
they're not even--

249
00:23:02,175 --> 00:23:04,350
Yeah, who's going to listen
to a madman?

250
00:23:04,351 --> 00:23:06,721
-Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch.
-Run!

251
00:23:10,879 --> 00:23:12,769
No one ever listens to me.

252
00:23:18,817 --> 00:23:19,808
Murdoch, stop!

253
00:24:00,962 --> 00:24:03,572
-How much further?
-We're almost there, buddy.

254
00:24:06,595 --> 00:24:08,898
You happen to know
the way to Shell Beach?

255
00:24:08,899 --> 00:24:11,875
You're kidding! Me and the wife
spent our honeymoon there.

256
00:24:11,876 --> 00:24:14,676
All you do is
take Main Street West to...

257
00:24:17,157 --> 00:24:20,291
Or is it the Cross...
Now, that's funny.

258
00:24:20,292 --> 00:24:23,332
l can't seem to remember
if it's Main Street West...

259
00:24:23,333 --> 00:24:24,581
or the Crosstown.

260
00:24:29,060 --> 00:24:32,036
l'm sorry, lnspector,
l cannot be of more assistance,

261
00:24:32,037 --> 00:24:33,955
but l am running late
for an appointment.

262
00:24:33,956 --> 00:24:36,006
Well, l appreciate you
taking the time.

263
00:24:44,389 --> 00:24:46,693
There's just one thing
that puzzles me.

264
00:24:46,725 --> 00:24:51,141
l've met quite a few murderers
in the course of my work.

265
00:24:51,142 --> 00:24:53,701
Murdoch doesn't
strike me as one.

266
00:24:53,765 --> 00:24:56,869
Perhaps you are not accustomed
to digging deep enough.

267
00:24:56,870 --> 00:24:59,654
Well, l do know when
someone is lying to me, Doctor.

268
00:24:59,655 --> 00:25:03,718
lnspector, judging personalities
happens to be my business.

269
00:25:03,719 --> 00:25:05,606
Maybe you can give me
a few pointers.

270
00:25:05,670 --> 00:25:09,478
Certainly.
Let's take you, for instance.

271
00:25:09,479 --> 00:25:12,456
You are a fastidious man.
Driven.

272
00:25:12,520 --> 00:25:14,727
Consumed by details.

273
00:25:14,759 --> 00:25:18,087
l would say
your life is rather lonely.

274
00:25:18,151 --> 00:25:20,983
Good evening, lnspector.
l really must be going.

275
00:25:56,841 --> 00:25:57,866
Come in.

276
00:26:02,698 --> 00:26:04,393
-How is he?
-The same.

277
00:26:05,643 --> 00:26:08,171
Walenski? lt's me, Frank.

278
00:26:14,313 --> 00:26:15,435
Come in, Frank.

279
00:26:18,570 --> 00:26:19,722
Close the door.

280
00:26:27,467 --> 00:26:30,667
l've been looking through
some of your old reports.

281
00:26:30,668 --> 00:26:32,652
lt's an interesting case.

282
00:26:33,739 --> 00:26:36,780
Kind that make a man's career.

283
00:26:38,445 --> 00:26:41,994
-Or break it.
-Yeah. l was on that case.

284
00:26:41,995 --> 00:26:45,708
And then what?
What happened then, Eddie?

285
00:26:45,709 --> 00:26:47,085
Nothing happened, Frank.

286
00:26:48,045 --> 00:26:50,027
l've just been spending time
in the subway,

287
00:26:50,028 --> 00:26:51,853
riding in circles.

288
00:26:51,885 --> 00:26:55,677
Thinking in circles.
There's no way out.

289
00:26:57,452 --> 00:26:59,053
l've been over this entire city.

290
00:27:03,372 --> 00:27:05,228
You're scaring your wife
to death, Eddie.

291
00:27:05,229 --> 00:27:06,637
She's not my wife.

292
00:27:08,428 --> 00:27:11,308
l don't know who she is
or who any of us are.

293
00:27:11,309 --> 00:27:14,942
-What makes you say that?
-You think about the past much?

294
00:27:16,526 --> 00:27:17,934
As much as the next guy.

295
00:27:18,926 --> 00:27:21,581
See, l've been trying
to remember things--

296
00:27:21,582 --> 00:27:24,527
clearly remember things
from my past.

297
00:27:24,589 --> 00:27:26,638
But the more
l try to think back,

298
00:27:26,703 --> 00:27:29,551
the more it all starts
to unravel.

299
00:27:29,615 --> 00:27:30,703
None of it seems real.

300
00:27:30,767 --> 00:27:34,797
lt's like l've just
been dreaming this life,

301
00:27:34,798 --> 00:27:37,678
and when l finally wake up,
l'll be somebody else,

302
00:27:37,679 --> 00:27:39,568
somebody totally different.

303
00:27:43,791 --> 00:27:45,840
You saw something,
didn't you, Eddie.

304
00:27:46,960 --> 00:27:49,360
Something to do with the case.

305
00:27:49,937 --> 00:27:53,200
There is no case!
There never was!

306
00:27:53,232 --> 00:27:56,976
lt's all just a big joke!
lt's a joke!

307
00:28:36,371 --> 00:28:38,002
Tonight's requirements are...

308
00:28:38,066 --> 00:28:41,171
12 family photo albums,

309
00:28:41,235 --> 00:28:43,539
nine personal diaries,

310
00:28:43,571 --> 00:28:45,618
17 love letters,

311
00:28:45,682 --> 00:28:47,986
assorted childhood photographs,

312
00:28:48,018 --> 00:28:52,082
requisite false l.D.s
and social security cards.

313
00:28:52,083 --> 00:28:54,229
These do bring back memories.

314
00:28:56,532 --> 00:28:58,676
This one is still warm.

315
00:28:59,475 --> 00:29:00,533
What is it?

316
00:29:00,597 --> 00:29:03,636
The recollections of
a great lover?

317
00:29:03,700 --> 00:29:05,908
A catalogue of conquests?

318
00:29:06,611 --> 00:29:08,021
We will soon find out.

319
00:29:09,269 --> 00:29:10,676
You wouldn't
appreciate that,

320
00:29:10,740 --> 00:29:13,813
would you,
Mr. Whatever-your-name is?

321
00:29:13,877 --> 00:29:18,406
Not the sort of conquest
you would ever understand.

322
00:29:18,773 --> 00:29:19,957
Let's see.

323
00:29:21,237 --> 00:29:23,797
A touch of
unhappy childhood...

324
00:29:29,270 --> 00:29:31,732
A dash of
teenage rebellion...

325
00:29:33,269 --> 00:29:36,214
And last but not least...

326
00:29:36,278 --> 00:29:38,742
a tragic death
in the family.

327
00:29:41,494 --> 00:29:43,063
Mr. Book.

328
00:29:49,782 --> 00:29:53,269
Why does Murdoch not sleep
during the Tuning?

329
00:29:53,270 --> 00:29:57,397
Maybe he's a step up
the evolutionary ladder.

330
00:29:57,398 --> 00:29:58,518
A freak of nature.

331
00:29:58,582 --> 00:30:01,366
He's adapting to survive.
What do you expect?

332
00:30:01,367 --> 00:30:03,192
Weren't you looking for
the human soul?

333
00:30:03,224 --> 00:30:05,781
lsn't that the purpose
of your little zoo?

334
00:30:05,782 --> 00:30:09,015
That's why you change people
and things every night.

335
00:30:09,016 --> 00:30:11,831
Maybe you have finally
found what you are looking for,

336
00:30:11,832 --> 00:30:13,305
and it's going to bite you
on your--

337
00:30:17,175 --> 00:30:19,063
lt requires several
of your lifetimes...

338
00:30:19,064 --> 00:30:20,633
to master our gifts.

339
00:30:20,697 --> 00:30:22,458
The idea that
a simple man...

340
00:30:22,488 --> 00:30:24,377
could develop the ability
to Tune is--

341
00:30:24,441 --> 00:30:25,497
Absurd, l know.

342
00:30:25,561 --> 00:30:27,768
What other explanation is there?

343
00:30:32,536 --> 00:30:33,626
lt is time.

344
00:31:17,691 --> 00:31:19,067
Shut it down.

345
00:31:36,860 --> 00:31:39,868
Fredrickson says he'll take me
off the night shift.

346
00:31:39,869 --> 00:31:41,660
lt's about time, dear.

347
00:32:30,336 --> 00:32:31,264
Hello?

348
00:32:39,233 --> 00:32:40,545
Wake up.

349
00:32:43,520 --> 00:32:44,928
Wake up!

350
00:32:54,624 --> 00:32:56,674
Can anyone hear me?

351
00:32:59,715 --> 00:33:02,433
Let the Tuning commence.

352
00:35:35,755 --> 00:35:37,065
The Goodwins.

353
00:35:37,098 --> 00:35:38,987
Charlie, Sylvia,

354
00:35:39,051 --> 00:35:41,034
Jane, and little Matthew.

355
00:35:44,778 --> 00:35:46,860
Jane and little Matthew.

356
00:36:15,821 --> 00:36:17,933
The rich get richer.

357
00:36:17,997 --> 00:36:20,012
Probably have
maid's quarters...

358
00:36:20,076 --> 00:36:21,388
before the night
is through.

359
00:37:12,751 --> 00:37:14,640
Dr. Schreber, l presume.

360
00:37:14,672 --> 00:37:16,080
lt's you.

361
00:37:16,145 --> 00:37:17,136
Hey, come on.

362
00:37:17,200 --> 00:37:19,247
That's no way to greet
a patient, Doctor,

363
00:37:19,248 --> 00:37:21,295
if that's what you are.

364
00:37:21,361 --> 00:37:22,735
Please, l--

365
00:37:22,767 --> 00:37:24,496
Why is everyone asleep?

366
00:37:24,560 --> 00:37:26,864
Please keep your voice down.

367
00:37:26,896 --> 00:37:28,784
l can't remember anything.
What have you done?

368
00:37:28,785 --> 00:37:31,440
Nothing. l want to help you.

369
00:37:31,504 --> 00:37:34,800
We cannot talk here.
lf they see us together--

370
00:37:34,801 --> 00:37:37,586
l don't care.
l want some answers. Now!

371
00:37:37,618 --> 00:37:40,656
Who are they?
Why are they trying to kill me?

372
00:37:40,657 --> 00:37:41,713
Answer me!

373
00:37:46,641 --> 00:37:47,600
My God.

374
00:37:47,664 --> 00:37:50,577
-You really can do it.
-l did that?

375
00:37:50,641 --> 00:37:53,105
Listen to me.
You have their power.

376
00:37:53,169 --> 00:37:55,090
You can make things happen
by will alone.

377
00:37:55,091 --> 00:37:56,593
They call it ''Tuning.''

378
00:37:56,657 --> 00:37:58,546
That is how they change
the buildings.

379
00:37:58,578 --> 00:38:00,978
Just now you acted
out of self-defense,

380
00:38:01,042 --> 00:38:03,730
but l can teach you
to control your power.

381
00:38:03,731 --> 00:38:07,939
We can stop them.
We can take the city back.

382
00:38:10,738 --> 00:38:12,147
My glasses.

383
00:39:04,182 --> 00:39:06,453
He made a terrible impression
for the firm,

384
00:39:06,454 --> 00:39:09,175
lollygagging around
as he did.

385
00:39:09,205 --> 00:39:12,022
So l told Fredrickson
l was letting him go.

386
00:39:12,023 --> 00:39:13,910
Well you should have, darling.

387
00:39:14,646 --> 00:39:17,958
He attacked me.
l don't know where he's gone.

388
00:39:18,071 --> 00:39:21,847
Come, Dr. Schreber.
We have much to do.

389
00:39:21,912 --> 00:39:24,376
-Yes?
-Yes.

390
00:39:26,711 --> 00:39:32,856
They say that
you're a runaround lover

391
00:39:33,911 --> 00:39:41,592
Though you say it isn't so

392
00:39:44,409 --> 00:39:50,969
But if you put me down
for another

393
00:39:52,504 --> 00:39:58,137
l'll know, believe me, l'll know

394
00:39:59,545 --> 00:40:02,968
Tonight's experiment will
take place in these locations.

395
00:40:02,969 --> 00:40:06,873
The first subject
shall be imprinted on Avenue M.

396
00:40:06,874 --> 00:40:09,722
Mr. Book, there is a problem.

397
00:40:09,786 --> 00:40:11,289
There is no Avenue M.

398
00:40:11,355 --> 00:40:13,146
We were unable
to complete it.

399
00:40:13,178 --> 00:40:16,568
During the last Tuning,
we detected a lack of control.

400
00:40:16,569 --> 00:40:19,643
An opposing influence
on the machines?

401
00:40:19,707 --> 00:40:23,800
This man Murdoch is
more powerful than we thought.

402
00:40:23,801 --> 00:40:25,658
He is becoming like us.

403
00:40:25,690 --> 00:40:28,986
So we must become like him.

404
00:40:29,883 --> 00:40:32,123
The doctor has done as we asked?

405
00:40:32,155 --> 00:40:36,075
The life and times
of John Murdoch, volume two.

406
00:40:37,628 --> 00:40:40,092
We must not do this.

407
00:40:40,156 --> 00:40:43,419
Murdoch does not possess
these memories, yes?

408
00:40:43,420 --> 00:40:46,171
How will his imprint
allow us to find him?

409
00:40:46,172 --> 00:40:49,499
Everywhere he goes,
everyone he seeks out...

410
00:40:49,500 --> 00:40:50,684
will be known to us.

411
00:40:50,748 --> 00:40:55,707
And as he follows the clues,
so shall we follow the memories.

412
00:40:55,708 --> 00:40:58,044
But to imprint one of us?

413
00:40:58,076 --> 00:41:00,636
Failure has always resulted.

414
00:41:00,700 --> 00:41:04,157
What Mr. Hand proposes
is our only option.

415
00:41:04,158 --> 00:41:05,692
lmprint.

416
00:41:10,909 --> 00:41:12,764
This may sting a bit.

417
00:41:47,774 --> 00:41:49,376
ls it done?

418
00:41:49,440 --> 00:41:51,774
Oh, yes, Mr. Book.

419
00:41:51,808 --> 00:41:55,488
l have John Murdoch in mind.

420
00:41:56,095 --> 00:41:57,632
''Johnny...

421
00:41:57,696 --> 00:42:01,565
''Found this postcard
among your mother's things.

422
00:42:01,566 --> 00:42:03,680
''Brings back memories,
doesn't it?

423
00:42:03,744 --> 00:42:05,505
''Stop by sometime.

424
00:42:05,567 --> 00:42:08,735
''We'll see if we can't
hook ourselves another mermaid.

425
00:42:08,736 --> 00:42:10,976
''Love to Emma. Karl.''

426
00:42:16,224 --> 00:42:17,152
Karl.

427
00:42:18,977 --> 00:42:20,545
Karl Harris.

428
00:42:28,386 --> 00:42:29,378
Harris.

429
00:42:37,345 --> 00:42:40,258
Excuse me.
Which way is Avenue C?

430
00:42:40,322 --> 00:42:41,474
Try the subway.

431
00:42:45,090 --> 00:42:46,498
You got a problem, pal?

432
00:42:46,562 --> 00:42:49,283
Been working here long?

433
00:42:49,315 --> 00:42:52,914
25 years.
No days off for good behavior.

434
00:43:16,644 --> 00:43:19,460
We're looking for John Murdoch.

435
00:43:52,262 --> 00:43:54,246
She knows nothing,
Mr. Hand.

436
00:43:54,310 --> 00:43:56,071
A dead end, Mr. Wall.

437
00:43:56,135 --> 00:43:58,790
We thought his imprint
would let us track him.

438
00:43:58,791 --> 00:44:01,191
But instead
we have been brought here.

439
00:44:01,255 --> 00:44:05,159
-This is irrational.
-lnstincts are irrational.

440
00:44:05,160 --> 00:44:08,295
We must follow
where they lead, yes?

441
00:44:08,359 --> 00:44:11,527
Mr. Sleep suggests he may go
to places familiar.

442
00:44:11,528 --> 00:44:12,806
His job.

443
00:44:12,840 --> 00:44:14,759
He does not care about our job.

444
00:44:14,824 --> 00:44:17,544
lndulge us, Mr. Hand.

445
00:44:17,576 --> 00:44:20,104
lf you were Murdoch, yes?

446
00:44:20,168 --> 00:44:23,368
lf l were Murdoch...

447
00:44:25,096 --> 00:44:28,487
l would remember how
my wife had hurt me...

448
00:44:28,488 --> 00:44:30,407
by sleeping with another man.

449
00:44:31,944 --> 00:44:33,352
And then...

450
00:44:35,209 --> 00:44:38,872
l would look for a way
to hurt her in return.

451
00:44:41,385 --> 00:44:46,136
Leave me alone with her.
There's work to be done.

452
00:44:49,288 --> 00:44:51,274
All change,
platform three.

453
00:44:53,866 --> 00:44:54,922
All change?

454
00:44:54,986 --> 00:44:57,224
Excuse me, how do l get
to the end of the line?

455
00:44:57,225 --> 00:44:58,634
You want the Express.

456
00:45:10,730 --> 00:45:13,097
How come the train didn't stop?

457
00:45:13,132 --> 00:45:14,346
That's the Express.

458
00:45:15,850 --> 00:45:17,675
There's no way out.

459
00:45:17,707 --> 00:45:20,828
You can't get out of the city.
l've tried.

460
00:45:21,483 --> 00:45:23,467
You're Murdoch, aren't you?

461
00:45:23,531 --> 00:45:25,099
The one
they've been looking for.

462
00:45:25,163 --> 00:45:26,219
You're not a killer.

463
00:45:26,283 --> 00:45:28,875
They set you up with
a fake identity,

464
00:45:28,940 --> 00:45:30,476
like everyone else here.

465
00:45:30,540 --> 00:45:32,363
-Who are you?
-l was a cop.

466
00:45:32,395 --> 00:45:35,372
At least in this life l was.

467
00:45:35,436 --> 00:45:38,189
They steal peoples' memories.

468
00:45:38,221 --> 00:45:39,916
Then they swap them around
between us.

469
00:45:39,980 --> 00:45:42,540
l seen them do it,
back and forth...

470
00:45:42,604 --> 00:45:44,619
till no one knows
who they are anymore.

471
00:45:44,683 --> 00:45:45,899
How do you know all this?

472
00:45:45,964 --> 00:45:47,660
Once in a while one of us
wakes up...

473
00:45:47,724 --> 00:45:49,101
while they're changing things.

474
00:45:49,964 --> 00:45:52,397
lt's not supposed to happen,
but it does.

475
00:45:52,398 --> 00:45:53,644
lt happened to me.

476
00:45:54,349 --> 00:45:56,172
They'll come looking for you.

477
00:45:57,260 --> 00:45:59,470
Just like they'll come
looking for me.

478
00:45:59,532 --> 00:46:00,878
But that's OK.

479
00:46:00,908 --> 00:46:02,060
l figured a way out.

480
00:46:13,038 --> 00:46:14,222
They were here.

481
00:46:16,237 --> 00:46:17,614
Last night.

482
00:46:17,646 --> 00:46:19,759
This was to be his home.

483
00:46:22,317 --> 00:46:24,046
That was when we loved her.

484
00:46:24,110 --> 00:46:26,286
This is all well and good,

485
00:46:26,350 --> 00:46:28,271
but we require
a more practical link...

486
00:46:28,335 --> 00:46:30,286
to his present whereabouts.

487
00:46:34,736 --> 00:46:36,655
And l know where to find her.

488
00:46:44,784 --> 00:46:47,983
We're very lucky,
when you think about it.

489
00:46:47,984 --> 00:46:48,943
l'm sorry?

490
00:46:49,007 --> 00:46:50,961
To be able to revisit
those places...

491
00:46:51,025 --> 00:46:52,912
which meant
so very much to us.

492
00:46:53,743 --> 00:46:56,145
l thought we were haunted
by them.

493
00:46:56,209 --> 00:46:57,840
Perhaps.

494
00:46:57,904 --> 00:47:00,303
There used to be a ferry
when l was a boy.

495
00:47:00,304 --> 00:47:02,257
Biggest thing you ever saw.

496
00:47:02,321 --> 00:47:05,010
Lit up like
a floating birthday cake.

497
00:47:06,384 --> 00:47:08,881
That's just what my husband
once said to me.

498
00:47:08,882 --> 00:47:10,352
On this very spot.

499
00:47:11,793 --> 00:47:13,778
Where is your husband now?

500
00:47:13,842 --> 00:47:17,490
l wish l knew.
What brings you here?

501
00:47:17,552 --> 00:47:20,305
l met my wife at this place.

502
00:47:20,337 --> 00:47:22,482
lt's where l met my husband.

503
00:47:22,544 --> 00:47:23,955
Small world.

504
00:48:15,892 --> 00:48:16,820
Hello?

505
00:49:02,263 --> 00:49:04,056
What are you doing here?

506
00:49:04,088 --> 00:49:05,624
l've been following you.

507
00:49:09,432 --> 00:49:11,033
Hold it right there!

508
00:49:13,048 --> 00:49:13,976
Johnny?

509
00:49:16,985 --> 00:49:18,201
lt's been so damn long,

510
00:49:18,263 --> 00:49:20,680
l thought you'd forgotten
your Uncle Karl.

511
00:49:21,464 --> 00:49:22,840
You son of a gun!

512
00:49:26,104 --> 00:49:27,224
Uncle Karl...

513
00:49:30,233 --> 00:49:31,160
Wait.

514
00:49:33,945 --> 00:49:35,960
-ls that me?
-Yeah.

515
00:49:43,929 --> 00:49:45,594
Shell Beach is where
l grew up?

516
00:49:45,658 --> 00:49:48,154
That's what l said.
Shell Beach.

517
00:49:48,218 --> 00:49:50,554
-Your home town.
-l need to get there.

518
00:49:50,586 --> 00:49:51,578
How do l get there?

519
00:49:52,954 --> 00:49:55,770
l don't know.
l haven't been there in years.

520
00:49:55,771 --> 00:49:58,923
You must remember.
You must have some idea.

521
00:50:00,410 --> 00:50:01,594
Sorry, Johnny.

522
00:50:02,971 --> 00:50:05,803
The old cracker barrel
ain't what it used to be.

523
00:50:09,083 --> 00:50:12,780
-lt was so bright there.
-Brighter times, l guess.

524
00:50:14,075 --> 00:50:17,275
You were always scribbling
in that damn book.

525
00:50:17,276 --> 00:50:19,163
That's me and your Pa.

526
00:50:19,195 --> 00:50:21,403
What a couple of
handsome fools.

527
00:50:21,469 --> 00:50:22,907
What happened to my parents?

528
00:50:25,371 --> 00:50:26,459
Where are they now?

529
00:50:27,677 --> 00:50:29,372
They're dead, Johnny.

530
00:50:29,436 --> 00:50:32,060
They died when the house
burned down.

531
00:50:32,124 --> 00:50:33,629
l looked after you.

532
00:50:34,524 --> 00:50:36,221
You don't remember that,
really?

533
00:50:38,942 --> 00:50:41,340
What's that? What is that?

534
00:50:46,941 --> 00:50:48,702
lt's a scar.

535
00:50:48,766 --> 00:50:51,373
You burned your arm pretty bad
in the fire.

536
00:50:56,350 --> 00:50:57,821
What does it mean?

537
00:50:57,885 --> 00:50:59,774
lt means these are all lies!

538
00:51:03,710 --> 00:51:05,918
My husband told me
he'd been here.

539
00:51:05,982 --> 00:51:08,639
He told me he wanted
to test himself.

540
00:51:08,703 --> 00:51:10,878
See if he was...

541
00:51:10,942 --> 00:51:13,150
capable of...

542
00:51:21,696 --> 00:51:23,423
l wanted to talk to her.

543
00:51:23,487 --> 00:51:25,376
l thought she could
help me find him.

544
00:51:27,039 --> 00:51:28,928
l'm going to call the station.

545
00:51:44,450 --> 00:51:45,601
lt's beautiful.

546
00:51:48,192 --> 00:51:50,914
lt was a gift from my mother.

547
00:51:50,944 --> 00:51:52,417
She died recently.

548
00:51:53,761 --> 00:51:55,936
l keep it with me
to remind me of her.

549
00:51:57,986 --> 00:51:58,977
l'm sorry.

550
00:52:02,529 --> 00:52:04,547
lt's a funny thing, though.

551
00:52:04,611 --> 00:52:07,345
l can't remember
when she gave it to me.

552
00:52:09,314 --> 00:52:12,050
How do you think l could
forget a thing like that?

553
00:52:13,059 --> 00:52:15,426
What's happening, lnspector?

554
00:52:15,459 --> 00:52:17,187
l'm not sure l know anymore.

555
00:52:21,028 --> 00:52:22,690
l left your old room
like it was.

556
00:52:23,716 --> 00:52:25,860
You can sleep here tonight.

557
00:52:25,924 --> 00:52:27,907
Glad to have you back, Johnny.

558
00:52:27,971 --> 00:52:30,595
-Even if it is for just a night.
-Karl.

559
00:52:31,715 --> 00:52:34,243
-ls that the right time?
-Why, sure.

560
00:52:34,308 --> 00:52:36,674
That clock's kept perfect time
since l bought it.

561
00:52:36,675 --> 00:52:37,924
A.M. or P.M.?

562
00:52:39,556 --> 00:52:41,891
-What do you think?
-l don't understand.

563
00:52:41,892 --> 00:52:44,579
How can it be night already?
What happened to the day?

564
00:52:44,580 --> 00:52:46,980
You're tired.
Anything's possible.

565
00:52:48,613 --> 00:52:49,541
Get some sleep.

566
00:52:49,573 --> 00:52:51,941
We'll straighten all this out
tomorrow.

567
00:53:22,757 --> 00:53:23,943
Come on...

568
00:53:43,527 --> 00:53:46,376
He's here.
He's acting peculiar.

569
00:53:46,438 --> 00:53:48,710
l know. He's not himself.

570
00:53:48,744 --> 00:53:50,695
Keep him there,
and l'll be right over.

571
00:53:50,759 --> 00:53:52,871
-l'll try.
-Thanks. Bye.

572
00:53:56,329 --> 00:53:59,928
l can't promise anything.
We'll play it as it comes.

573
00:54:00,265 --> 00:54:02,953
We just wanted to help.

574
00:54:09,448 --> 00:54:12,906
Karl. Uncle Karl.

575
00:54:12,968 --> 00:54:16,665
lf you're in trouble,
maybe we can do something.

576
00:54:17,674 --> 00:54:20,074
Haven't seen you in so long.

577
00:55:31,597 --> 00:55:36,445
Mr. Murdoch, you've been
the cause of much distress.

578
00:55:40,718 --> 00:55:43,053
-Start talking.
-There's no need for this.

579
00:55:43,054 --> 00:55:46,509
There's no escape.
The city's ours. We made it.

580
00:55:46,510 --> 00:55:47,790
What are you talking about?

581
00:55:47,854 --> 00:55:50,862
We fashioned this city
on stolen memories.

582
00:55:50,863 --> 00:55:54,478
Different eras, different pasts,
all rolled into one.

583
00:55:54,479 --> 00:55:58,414
Each night we revise it,
refine it, in order to learn.

584
00:55:58,415 --> 00:56:01,294
-Learn what?
-About you.

585
00:56:01,358 --> 00:56:05,614
You and your fellow inhabitants.
What makes you human.

586
00:56:05,615 --> 00:56:08,943
-Why?
-We need to be like you.

587
00:56:09,712 --> 00:56:11,759
l understand you now.

588
00:56:11,824 --> 00:56:15,310
l remember that which you do
not, what you've been missing.

589
00:56:15,311 --> 00:56:20,655
The ocean, yes? Running along
the waves as a child.

590
00:56:20,656 --> 00:56:25,377
Meeting Emma at the river,
that first kiss that followed.

591
00:56:25,937 --> 00:56:28,975
-What are you?
-You've seen what we are.

592
00:56:28,976 --> 00:56:31,440
We use your dead as vessels.

593
00:58:35,833 --> 00:58:36,760
Get in!

594
00:58:51,608 --> 00:58:55,416
-What about her? Ring a bell?
-She was alive when l left her.

595
00:58:55,417 --> 00:58:58,330
-What about this?
-This is nothing.

596
00:58:58,394 --> 00:59:00,536
lt must mean something--
all those pictures.

597
00:59:00,537 --> 00:59:01,465
What pictures?

598
00:59:02,905 --> 00:59:05,689
-l don't understand this.
-Stop playing games with me.

599
00:59:05,690 --> 00:59:08,089
-Stop telling me lies.
-l am not telling lies!

600
00:59:08,090 --> 00:59:10,297
Help me out.
Make me understand.

601
00:59:10,361 --> 00:59:15,160
l have this jigsaw puzzle in
my face, and it makes no sense.

602
00:59:15,161 --> 00:59:18,426
You think it makes sense to me?
l'm as confused as you are.

603
00:59:18,427 --> 00:59:22,202
Let me ask you a question.
Have you heard of Shell Beach?

604
00:59:22,203 --> 00:59:24,250
-Sure.
-You know how to get there?

605
00:59:24,314 --> 00:59:25,883
-Yeah.
-Tell me.

606
00:59:26,458 --> 00:59:31,513
-Right. You just go to the...
-Where? Where do you go?

607
00:59:31,514 --> 00:59:33,083
Give me a second, will you?

608
00:59:34,970 --> 00:59:36,474
You can't remember, can you?

609
00:59:37,851 --> 00:59:40,218
Thinking that's kind of odd?

610
00:59:41,402 --> 00:59:43,388
Wait. l got a better one.

611
00:59:43,452 --> 00:59:47,436
When was the last time you
did something during the day?

612
00:59:47,643 --> 00:59:50,891
-What do you mean?
-l just mean during the day.

613
00:59:51,675 --> 00:59:54,331
Daylight. When was the last
time you remember seeing it?

614
00:59:54,332 --> 00:59:57,915
l'm not talking about a distant,
half-forgotten childhood memory.

615
00:59:57,916 --> 01:00:00,940
l mean, like, yesterday.
Last week? When?

616
01:00:01,499 --> 01:00:03,164
Do you have a single memory?

617
01:00:04,893 --> 01:00:06,526
You don't, do you?

618
01:00:06,588 --> 01:00:11,932
l don't think the sun
even exists in this place.

619
01:00:11,933 --> 01:00:16,301
'Cause l've been up for hours
and hours, and night never ends.

620
01:00:16,508 --> 01:00:18,749
-That's crazy.
-You're damn right it's crazy.

621
01:00:18,750 --> 01:00:22,205
But listen to me, Bumstead.
lt's not just me.

622
01:00:22,206 --> 01:00:25,053
lt's all of us. They're doing
something to all of us.

623
01:00:25,054 --> 01:00:26,813
Shut up.
l've heard enough.

624
01:00:26,877 --> 01:00:29,470
-Please listen--
-Shut up!

625
01:00:39,518 --> 01:00:42,142
There has to be an explanation.

626
01:00:49,246 --> 01:00:50,176
Explain this.

627
01:01:11,136 --> 01:01:12,544
l'm so sorry.

628
01:01:13,632 --> 01:01:16,480
l never meant to hurt you.
l don't know why l did.

629
01:01:16,481 --> 01:01:18,144
l wish l could take it back.

630
01:01:18,849 --> 01:01:21,024
You didn't do it.

631
01:01:21,088 --> 01:01:22,721
This affair of yours,

632
01:01:22,785 --> 01:01:25,727
whatever you think you've done,
you didn't do it.

633
01:01:25,728 --> 01:01:26,882
l don't believe it happened.

634
01:01:26,944 --> 01:01:30,623
-What do you mean?
-This will sound crazy.

635
01:01:30,624 --> 01:01:33,664
What if we never knew
each other before now?

636
01:01:33,665 --> 01:01:39,680
What if the first time we met
was last night in our apartment?

637
01:01:39,681 --> 01:01:42,273
And everything you remember,

638
01:01:42,337 --> 01:01:45,442
and everything l'm supposed to
remember never really happened.

639
01:01:45,443 --> 01:01:47,810
Someone just wants us
to think it did.

640
01:01:48,738 --> 01:01:50,178
But how can that be true?

641
01:01:50,785 --> 01:01:53,634
l so vividly remember
meeting you.

642
01:01:54,914 --> 01:01:57,154
l remember falling in love
with you.

643
01:01:58,722 --> 01:02:01,539
-l remember losing you.
-Time's up.

644
01:02:03,076 --> 01:02:07,619
No, wait, please.
Just one more minute.

645
01:02:13,891 --> 01:02:15,332
l love you, John.

646
01:02:18,627 --> 01:02:20,677
You can't fake something
like that.

647
01:02:22,309 --> 01:02:23,718
No, you can't.

648
01:02:51,814 --> 01:02:54,246
lnspector? Sir?

649
01:02:55,622 --> 01:02:58,582
Detective Walenski
killed himself last night.

650
01:03:00,486 --> 01:03:01,830
l thought you should know.

651
01:03:04,358 --> 01:03:08,487
The chief wanted to see you.
Sir?

652
01:03:15,144 --> 01:03:16,967
l knew you'd track
the killer down.

653
01:03:31,816 --> 01:03:32,871
Shoelace.

654
01:03:45,544 --> 01:03:48,953
-How can we help you, sir?
-You can sleep.

655
01:03:51,881 --> 01:03:53,481
Sleep. Sleep.

656
01:03:57,129 --> 01:03:58,185
Evening.

657
01:04:10,603 --> 01:04:14,427
l wanted to be the first to
congratulate you about the case.

658
01:04:16,523 --> 01:04:19,212
Take us to Murdoch.

659
01:04:19,276 --> 01:04:20,203
Sleep.

660
01:04:49,485 --> 01:04:50,988
l knew you'd come eventually.

661
01:04:51,052 --> 01:04:53,420
lsn't it time
you gave me some answers?

662
01:04:54,702 --> 01:04:57,724
Yes, of course.
Won't you please sit down?

663
01:05:00,461 --> 01:05:02,252
l come here often.

664
01:05:02,317 --> 01:05:05,149
lt's one of the few places
l'm allowed some peace.

665
01:05:05,197 --> 01:05:08,510
You see, they have
an aversion to water.

666
01:05:09,070 --> 01:05:10,957
One could almost call it
a phobia.

667
01:05:11,438 --> 01:05:13,997
Who are they?
What do they want from me?

668
01:05:13,998 --> 01:05:14,927
Right.

669
01:05:15,630 --> 01:05:20,205
For now, let's say you're
the subject of their experiment.

670
01:05:20,206 --> 01:05:21,582
We all are.

671
01:05:23,183 --> 01:05:28,813
l'm sorry, but l have no time
to do this the right way.

672
01:05:28,814 --> 01:05:32,718
Everything you need to know
is in this syringe.

673
01:05:32,719 --> 01:05:36,173
l need you to inject yourself.
lt's the only way to understand.

674
01:05:36,174 --> 01:05:38,894
-You're kidding, right?
-We're running out of time!

675
01:05:38,895 --> 01:05:42,448
-You have to do this now.
-Give me the gun.

676
01:05:42,449 --> 01:05:44,496
He's more disturbed
than we thought.

677
01:05:44,560 --> 01:05:47,344
l may not be the judge
of personality you are,

678
01:05:47,345 --> 01:05:50,191
but you're the one
who looks disturbed.

679
01:05:50,223 --> 01:05:52,625
You don't know what
you're doing.

680
01:05:53,807 --> 01:05:57,551
What exactly is in this, Doctor?

681
01:05:59,184 --> 01:06:02,593
All the answers you've been
looking for, l swear to you.

682
01:06:04,080 --> 01:06:09,616
Guess l'll hold on to it for
safekeeping, if you don't mind.

683
01:06:09,617 --> 01:06:10,897
Let's go, Doctor.

684
01:06:12,402 --> 01:06:15,409
Go? Where are we going?

685
01:06:15,826 --> 01:06:17,490
Shell Beach.

686
01:06:18,546 --> 01:06:22,273
That's where you wanted to go,
isn't it, the ocean?

687
01:06:30,353 --> 01:06:33,682
Won't find anything there.
l've been there--

688
01:06:33,683 --> 01:06:35,891
Then you can show us the way.

689
01:06:35,955 --> 01:06:39,505
l won't. l refuse.
You can't make me go there.

690
01:06:39,506 --> 01:06:42,242
Don't you understand?
They'll be waiting for us.

691
01:06:50,771 --> 01:06:55,428
l don't understand.
There used to be a bridge here.

692
01:07:00,213 --> 01:07:03,186
Try that again, and your friends
will find you in the canal.

693
01:07:03,187 --> 01:07:04,947
Don't hurt me.
l'll tell you everything.

694
01:07:04,948 --> 01:07:06,611
lt doesn't matter anymore
anyway.

695
01:07:13,236 --> 01:07:14,166
What?

696
01:07:17,429 --> 01:07:18,901
Who are you people?

697
01:07:19,318 --> 01:07:21,972
Must go to the end
of the canal.

698
01:07:23,252 --> 01:07:26,151
We will give you some more
pretty things soon...

699
01:07:26,870 --> 01:07:29,078
-Anna.
-l'm not Anna.

700
01:07:30,711 --> 01:07:32,662
You will be soon, yes.

701
01:07:36,759 --> 01:07:39,477
l have another use
for her first.

702
01:07:48,598 --> 01:07:50,423
l call them Strangers.

703
01:07:50,968 --> 01:07:53,302
They abducted us
and brought us here.

704
01:07:54,456 --> 01:07:58,742
This city, everyone in it...
is their experiment.

705
01:07:58,743 --> 01:08:01,366
They mix and match our memories
as they see fit,

706
01:08:01,367 --> 01:08:03,895
trying to divine
what makes us unique.

707
01:08:04,408 --> 01:08:07,095
One day, a man might be
an inspector.

708
01:08:07,159 --> 01:08:09,817
The next,
someone entirely different.

709
01:08:10,200 --> 01:08:13,526
When they want to study
a murderer, for instance,

710
01:08:13,527 --> 01:08:17,847
they simply imprint one of their
citizens with a new personality.

711
01:08:17,848 --> 01:08:21,976
Arrange a family for him,
friends, an entire history...

712
01:08:21,977 --> 01:08:23,736
even a lost wallet.

713
01:08:23,800 --> 01:08:25,817
Then they observe the results.

714
01:08:27,066 --> 01:08:31,434
Will a man, given the history of
a killer, continue in that vein?

715
01:08:31,513 --> 01:08:35,000
Or are we, in fact, more than
the sum of our memories?

716
01:08:35,001 --> 01:08:39,754
This business of you being
a killer was a sad coincidence.

717
01:08:39,993 --> 01:08:42,520
You have had dozens of lives
before now.

718
01:08:42,521 --> 01:08:43,897
You happened to wake up...

719
01:08:43,929 --> 01:08:46,681
while l was imprinting you
with this one.

720
01:08:46,682 --> 01:08:48,571
Why are they doing all this?

721
01:08:48,633 --> 01:08:52,633
lt is our capacity for
individuality, our souls...

722
01:08:52,634 --> 01:08:54,362
that makes us different
from them.

723
01:08:54,427 --> 01:08:56,825
They think they'll find
the human soul...

724
01:08:56,826 --> 01:08:59,450
if they understand
how our memories work.

725
01:08:59,451 --> 01:09:03,771
They have collective memories.
They share one group mind.

726
01:09:03,772 --> 01:09:08,475
They're dying. Their race is
on the brink of extinction.

727
01:09:08,476 --> 01:09:11,419
-They think we can save them.
-Where do l fit in?

728
01:09:11,420 --> 01:09:16,140
You're different. You resisted
my attempt to imprint you.

729
01:09:20,475 --> 01:09:23,836
Somehow, you have developed
their ability to Tune.

730
01:09:23,837 --> 01:09:27,003
That is how they change things,
how they built this city.

731
01:09:27,004 --> 01:09:29,820
They have machines buried
beneath the surface...

732
01:09:29,821 --> 01:09:33,580
that allow them to focus
their telepathic energies.

733
01:09:33,916 --> 01:09:36,477
They control everything here,
even the sun.

734
01:09:36,478 --> 01:09:39,580
That's why it's always dark.
They can't stand the light.

735
01:09:39,581 --> 01:09:40,925
Why do they need you?

736
01:09:40,989 --> 01:09:42,876
When they first brought us here,

737
01:09:42,908 --> 01:09:47,068
they extracted what was in us
and stored the information,

738
01:09:47,069 --> 01:09:48,924
remixed it like paint...

739
01:09:48,958 --> 01:09:51,421
and gave us back
new memories of their choosing.

740
01:09:51,422 --> 01:09:55,278
But they still needed an artist
to help them.

741
01:09:56,575 --> 01:10:01,374
l understood the human mind
better than they ever could,

742
01:10:01,375 --> 01:10:04,861
so they allowed me to keep
my skills as a scientist...

743
01:10:04,862 --> 01:10:06,207
because they needed them.

744
01:10:06,271 --> 01:10:08,575
They made me delete
everything else.

745
01:10:16,830 --> 01:10:21,182
Can you imagine what it's like
to erase your own past?

746
01:10:21,183 --> 01:10:24,654
What about my past?
What about my childhood?

747
01:10:25,152 --> 01:10:27,103
Shell Beach. Uncle Karl.

748
01:10:28,287 --> 01:10:32,255
What about this?
This was blank when l found it.

749
01:10:32,256 --> 01:10:35,999
You still don't understand.
You were never a boy.

750
01:10:36,000 --> 01:10:37,216
Not in this place.

751
01:10:37,280 --> 01:10:40,095
Your history is an illusion,
a fabrication,

752
01:10:40,096 --> 01:10:41,823
as it is with all of us.

753
01:10:41,887 --> 01:10:44,350
You made those drawings happen
with your gift.

754
01:10:44,351 --> 01:10:45,762
You say they brought us here.

755
01:10:48,066 --> 01:10:48,993
From where?

756
01:10:52,737 --> 01:10:55,746
l'm sorry. l don't remember.

757
01:10:56,578 --> 01:11:00,641
None of us remember that...
what we once were...

758
01:11:00,642 --> 01:11:04,434
what we might have been...
somewhere else.

759
01:11:21,122 --> 01:11:24,771
l've taken you this far.
You don't need me anymore.

760
01:11:24,772 --> 01:11:25,699
Let's go.

761
01:12:09,253 --> 01:12:11,397
There is no ocean, John.

762
01:12:12,645 --> 01:12:14,694
There's nothing beyond the city.

763
01:12:16,263 --> 01:12:18,631
The only place home exists...

764
01:12:20,774 --> 01:12:22,279
is in your head.

765
01:12:33,255 --> 01:12:34,182
Stop!

766
01:12:46,791 --> 01:12:47,718
Please!

767
01:13:07,753 --> 01:13:09,769
Now you know the truth.

768
01:14:06,891 --> 01:14:09,453
You'll allow yourself
to surrender...

769
01:14:09,515 --> 01:14:11,693
or it will result in
this one's death.

770
01:14:11,757 --> 01:14:12,877
What do l care?

771
01:14:13,323 --> 01:14:15,372
She's not my real wife.
She's nothing to me.

772
01:14:15,373 --> 01:14:19,883
But you do still care,
don't you, Mr. Murdoch?

773
01:14:19,884 --> 01:14:24,349
l have become the monster
you were intended to be.

774
01:14:25,870 --> 01:14:29,630
Shall l end her life now,
as you would have?

775
01:14:32,653 --> 01:14:38,109
-Don't hurt her, please.
-Then surrender.

776
01:14:39,853 --> 01:14:40,783
Sleep.

777
01:14:42,862 --> 01:14:43,789
Now.

778
01:15:02,318 --> 01:15:03,247
Sleep.

779
01:15:11,952 --> 01:15:13,264
Kill him.

780
01:15:13,328 --> 01:15:14,256
Kill him !

781
01:15:24,400 --> 01:15:27,696
He is powerful, yes, dangerous.

782
01:15:27,760 --> 01:15:30,992
But he can also lead us
to what we seek...

783
01:15:30,993 --> 01:15:34,000
what the doctor calls the soul.

784
01:15:34,064 --> 01:15:37,904
lt is time for our experiment
to move into a final phase.

785
01:15:37,905 --> 01:15:40,561
We no longer need
the other subjects.

786
01:15:40,625 --> 01:15:43,826
The time for study is over.

787
01:15:43,890 --> 01:15:48,017
lt is time to be one
with John Murdoch.

788
01:15:54,578 --> 01:15:57,779
lt is time, Doctor. lmprint.

789
01:16:00,337 --> 01:16:02,419
Shut it down!

790
01:16:03,314 --> 01:16:05,586
Shut it down forever.

791
01:16:19,667 --> 01:16:20,691
What are you doing?

792
01:16:21,588 --> 01:16:26,468
They want to imprint you with
their own collective memories.

793
01:16:27,156 --> 01:16:29,235
They want to make you
one of them...

794
01:16:29,299 --> 01:16:31,381
so they can share your soul.

795
01:16:31,445 --> 01:16:33,652
But l've got other plans.

796
01:16:36,916 --> 01:16:39,636
lmprint, Doctor.
No more disobedience.

797
01:16:39,700 --> 01:16:44,550
l'm sorry. The pain will
only last a moment.

798
01:16:54,837 --> 01:16:56,438
Remember, John.

799
01:16:57,429 --> 01:16:59,446
You'll rise to greater heights
than that.

800
01:16:59,447 --> 01:17:02,181
One day when you're older,
you'll understand.

801
01:17:03,063 --> 01:17:03,990
Remember.

802
01:17:05,334 --> 01:17:08,086
That's it, John.
Practice makes perfect.

803
01:17:08,087 --> 01:17:11,542
Now, remember what l told you.
Never talk to strangers.

804
01:17:11,543 --> 01:17:12,823
John, remember.

805
01:17:13,045 --> 01:17:15,733
You're probably wondering why l
keep appearing in your memories.

806
01:17:15,734 --> 01:17:18,100
lt's because l have
inserted myself in them.

807
01:17:18,101 --> 01:17:21,975
They were fabricated to
teach you about the Strangers.

808
01:17:21,976 --> 01:17:25,319
Give you a lifetime of knowledge
in a single syringe.

809
01:17:27,671 --> 01:17:32,184
You will survive, John. You'll
find strength within yourself.

810
01:17:32,185 --> 01:17:33,655
And you will prevail.

811
01:17:34,328 --> 01:17:35,384
Remember.

812
01:17:36,087 --> 01:17:38,201
-Hi, Uncle Karl.
-Johnny!

813
01:17:41,047 --> 01:17:45,384
Getting the hang of it, John.
Maybe one day l'll work for you.

814
01:17:45,593 --> 01:17:49,111
Here's the machine the Strangers
use to amplify their thoughts,

815
01:17:49,112 --> 01:17:50,777
the machine that changes
their world.

816
01:17:50,839 --> 01:17:54,008
You must take control of it.
You must make the machine yours.

817
01:17:54,009 --> 01:17:58,794
l know you can beat them,
but you must concentrate.

818
01:18:00,345 --> 01:18:01,497
Something's wrong.

819
01:18:09,945 --> 01:18:11,738
There is no time for romance.

820
01:18:11,802 --> 01:18:13,785
The world can be
what you make it.

821
01:18:14,779 --> 01:18:15,770
What have you done?

822
01:18:16,826 --> 01:18:18,937
You have the power
to make anything happen...

823
01:18:18,938 --> 01:18:20,763
but you must act now.

824
01:22:53,449 --> 01:22:57,609
l knew you could do it, John.
You have their power now.

825
01:22:57,610 --> 01:23:00,186
-You control their machines.
-Where's Emma?

826
01:23:00,906 --> 01:23:05,194
She's not Emma anymore.
She has been reimprinted.

827
01:23:05,195 --> 01:23:07,401
-So give her back her memories.
-l can't.

828
01:23:07,402 --> 01:23:11,707
The facility where they stored
the memories has been destroyed.

829
01:23:12,106 --> 01:23:13,034
l'm sorry.

830
01:23:14,410 --> 01:23:16,299
What are you going to do now?

831
01:23:19,180 --> 01:23:20,588
l'm gonna fix things.

832
01:23:22,187 --> 01:23:25,724
You told me l had the power,
didn't you?

833
01:23:26,251 --> 01:23:29,500
l can make these machines
do anything l want.

834
01:23:30,092 --> 01:23:32,443
Make this world
anything l want it to be.

835
01:23:33,259 --> 01:23:37,533
Just so long as l concentrate
hard enough.

836
01:24:57,393 --> 01:24:58,545
Where are you going?

837
01:25:01,905 --> 01:25:02,834
Shell Beach.

838
01:25:42,548 --> 01:25:43,956
-What's the fare?
-A quarter.

839
01:25:50,485 --> 01:25:52,115
-Please.
-Oh, no, sit.

840
01:25:53,395 --> 01:25:54,325
Thank you.

841
01:26:38,486 --> 01:26:40,311
Been waiting for you, yes?

842
01:26:41,014 --> 01:26:45,174
-What are you doing?
-l'm just making a few changes.

843
01:26:45,175 --> 01:26:49,942
-We're sure that's what we want?
-l'll take my chances.

844
01:26:49,943 --> 01:26:55,543
l'm dying, John. Your imprint
is not agreeable with my kind.

845
01:26:55,544 --> 01:26:57,623
But l wanted to know
what it was like.

846
01:26:59,288 --> 01:27:00,824
How you feel.

847
01:27:00,887 --> 01:27:03,449
You know how l was
supposed to feel.

848
01:27:03,511 --> 01:27:07,415
That person isn't me.
Never was.

849
01:27:07,479 --> 01:27:10,920
You wanted to know what it was
that makes us human.

850
01:27:11,608 --> 01:27:15,592
Well, you're not going to
find it in here.

851
01:27:16,793 --> 01:27:18,487
You went looking
in the wrong place.

852
01:28:53,662 --> 01:28:55,359
lt's so beautiful here.

853
01:29:00,640 --> 01:29:01,822
So bright.

854
01:29:07,869 --> 01:29:10,223
Do you know if Shell Beach
is around here?

855
01:29:10,558 --> 01:29:12,800
l think that's it over there.

856
01:29:30,336 --> 01:29:32,224
l'm headed that way myself.

857
01:29:34,143 --> 01:29:35,425
Would you like to join me?

858
01:29:38,464 --> 01:29:39,393
Sure.

859
01:29:44,640 --> 01:29:48,002
l'm Anna, by the way.
What's your name?

860
01:29:48,143 --> 01:29:49,343
John.

861
01:29:51,144 --> 01:29:52,944
John Murdoch.
